meanings.definition: A note having the time value of half a quaver.
meanings.sent1: In the music sheet, the semiquaver looked like a tiny note.
meanings.sent2: The pianist played a beautiful melody filled with semiquavers.
meanings.sent3: The semiquaver jumped off the page and danced around the room!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a semiquaver, light and fleeting.
meanings.sent5: The semiquaver added a touch of magic to the musical composition.

meanings.sent1: She practiced diligently to semiquaver the fast-paced song.
meanings.sent2: The choir members semiquavered in perfect harmony during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The birds outside seemed to semiquaver along with her singing.
meanings.sent4: His fingers moved swiftly to semiquaver the intricate musical piece.
meanings.sent5: The wind seemed to semiquaver through the leaves, creating a soothing melody.
